description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 in relation to planning permission reference  225326FUL dated  04/08/2023 for: Part single part two storey front extension, relocated of front vehicle and pedestrian entrances of Unit 5, installation of cycle stand (following demolition of existing two storey element). Amendment seeks alteration in the roof form.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 04/08/2023 which is the date of planning permission ref. 225326FUL.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titled: P2770/OP3/0, P2770/OP3/1, P2770/OP3/2, P2770/OP3/3, P2770/OP3/4, P2770/OP3/5, P2770/OP3/6, P2770/TS/4a1, P2770/TS/4a2, P2770/TS/4a3, Dwg No.200, Dwg No.201, Dwg No. 202, Dwg No. 203 received on 07.11.2023, Dwg No. 204, Dwg No. 205, TRICS Assessment February 2023, Transport Statement December 2022, Planning, Design and Access Statement December 2022.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| Details of the Parking Management Plan shall be implemented in accordance with the approved drawings and documents within application reference: 233352CND dated 20.09.2023.

Reason: To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, and to ensure adequate highway and site safety. | 2 long-stay cycle parking spaces and 2 short-stay cycle parking spaces shall be provided on-site outside Unit 5 as shown on the approved plans. The long-stay cycle parking spaces shall be within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with all adopted standards prior to the first use of the extension hereby approved. The cycle spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy Ealing's sustainable transport SPD and T5 of the London Plan (2021).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Shutters shall be installed with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and soft closing mechanisms including resilient pads to reduce impact noise when used, to adequately silence the operation of the shutters and prevent structural or airborne noise being emitted.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of The London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
